text: wow .. the v3 PHP SDK API is super raw (ie. no 'higher' level functions .. even just fetching a contact by email requires tons of line of code) .. and it seems like v1 API had a createOrUpdate() endpoint but v3 API does not .. super sad development
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/create_or_update>
<https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-php#search-for-a-contact>

`$searchRequest->setProperties(['email', 'foo_bar']);`

how to filter business by date ?

We have a HubSpot app we use for accessing the API for a SaaS product we built - just recently I started getting this error when going through the oauth process. Was something updated recently with the oauth process? It was working as recently as last week
I can confirm that the App credentials are all accurate
Seems to be related to a breaking change for scopes that wasn't properly communicated
Could anyone confirm that merging two Deals does NOT fire the `deal.creation` webhook? (This seems like it really should…)
We’re trying to keep references in our app in sync and it seems impossible without constantly polling to see if a deal has been merged

`deal.creation` events for the merged deal (with the new id) don’t seem to fire

`deal.propertyUpdate` events for `id` or `hs_merged_object_ids` don’t fire either

In case anyone finds this later, as a partial workaround we were able to add `hs_merged_object_ids` as an additional property to send on our CRM Card requests and we use this to update our internal references “on the fly” so that we can show the correct data after a Deal has been merged
hey derek!  any more info?
what scope change are you referencing?

how can I use propertiesWithHistory in a deals?

Has anyone found a good way to bulk-fetch associations between CRM objects of two given types?

The best I can find uses list calls with the `associations` option, but that involves a pretty wicked optimization problem: <https://lukasschwab.me/blog/gen/graphs-at-work.html>
